title: England vs Australia Rugby World Cup time, TV channel, odds and head-to-head
text:
England are favourites to make it into the semi-finals (Picture: MB Media/Getty Images)

England and Australia meet in the Rugby World Cup quarter-finals on Saturday morning with the English very well rested ahead of this one.

Eddie Jones’ side played just three of their scheduled Pool C contests, with Typhoon Hagibis seeing their clash with France cancelled.

This means England have not played since their win over Argentina on 5 October and will be as fresh as they could have hoped to be ahead of a meeting with the Wallabies.

Australia had a tougher time in their Pool D campaign, during which they lost to Wales and battled through tough contests against Fiji and Georgia to set up the clash with England.

When is England vs Australia in the Rugby World Cup quarter-final?

The sides meet on Saturday 19 October with kick-off at 8.15am UK time.

The match is being played at the Oita Bank Dome in Japan where the time will be 4.15pm.

Australia lost to Wales in the pool stage (Picture: Getty Images)

What TV channel is England vs Australia on and is there a live stream?

Advertisement

Advertisement

ITV will be showing the game live and you will be able to stream it through the ITV Hub if you sign up for an account.

England vs Australia odds

1.4 England (2/5)

3.8 Australia (14/5)

Odds courtesy of Betfair Exchange

England vs Australia head-to-head record

England and Australia have an incredibly tight history in rugby union, dating back to 1909.

They have played 50 times in all competitions, with Australia winning 25 of them, England claiming 24 wins and there being one draw (at Twickenham in 1997).

Recently, though, England have dominated the meetings, winning the last six matches between the two sides.

The most recent game so the English triumph 37-18 at Twickenham in the Autumn Internationals in November 2018.
